segment.source: Domain member Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) (Windows 10)
segment.target: Domain member Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) (Windows 10)

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) security policy setting.

segment.source: Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)
segment.target: Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, and security considerations for the Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) security policy setting.

segment.source: Reference
segment.target: Reference

segment.source: This setting determines whether all secure channel traffic that is initiated by the domain member meets minimum security requirements.
segment.target: This setting determines whether all secure channel traffic that is initiated by the domain member meets minimum security requirements.

segment.source: Specifically, it determines whether all secure channel traffic that is initiated by the domain member must be encrypted.
segment.target: Specifically, it determines whether all secure channel traffic that is initiated by the domain member must be encrypted.

segment.source: Logon information that is transmitted over the secure channel is always encrypted regardless of whether the encryption of all other secure channel traffic is negotiated.
segment.target: Logon information that is transmitted over the secure channel is always encrypted regardless of whether the encryption of all other secure channel traffic is negotiated.

segment.source: In addition to this policy setting, the following policy settings determine whether a secure channel can be established with a domain controller that is not capable of signing or encrypting secure channel traffic:
segment.target: In addition to this policy setting, the following policy settings determine whether a secure channel can be established with a domain controller that is not capable of signing or encrypting secure channel traffic:

segment.source: Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)
segment.target: Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)

segment.source: Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)
segment.target: Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)

segment.source: Setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) to Enabled prevents establishing a secure channel with any domain controller that cannot sign or encrypt all secure channel data.
segment.target: Setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) to Enabled prevents establishing a secure channel with any domain controller that cannot sign or encrypt all secure channel data.

segment.source: To protect authentication traffic from man-in-the-middle, replay, and other types of network attacks, Windows-based computers create a communication channel through NetLogon called secure channels.
segment.target: To protect authentication traffic from man-in-the-middle, replay, and other types of network attacks, Windows-based computers create a communication channel through NetLogon called secure channels.

segment.source: These channels authenticate machine accounts.
segment.target: These channels authenticate machine accounts.

segment.source: They also authenticate user accounts when a remote user connects to a network resource and the user account exists in a trusted domain.
segment.target: They also authenticate user accounts when a remote user connects to a network resource and the user account exists in a trusted domain.

segment.source: This is called pass-through authentication, and it allows a computer running the Windows operating system that has joined a domain to have access to the user account database in its domain and in any trusted domains.
segment.target: This is called pass-through authentication, and it allows a computer running the Windows operating system that has joined a domain to have access to the user account database in its domain and in any trusted domains.

segment.source: Enabling the Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) policy setting automatically enables the Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible) policy setting.
segment.target: Enabling the Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) policy setting automatically enables the Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible) policy setting.

segment.source: When a device joins a domain, a machine account is created.
segment.target: When a device joins a domain, a machine account is created.

segment.source: After joining the domain, the device uses the password for that account to create a secure channel with the domain controller for its domain every time it restarts.
segment.target: After joining the domain, the device uses the password for that account to create a secure channel with the domain controller for its domain every time it restarts.

segment.source: This secure channel is used to perform operations such as NTLM pass through authentication and LSA SID/name Lookup.
segment.target: This secure channel is used to perform operations such as NTLM pass through authentication and LSA SID/name Lookup.

segment.source: Requests that are sent on the secure channel are authenticated—and sensitive information such as passwords are encrypted—but the integrity of the channel is not checked, and not all information is encrypted.
segment.target: Requests that are sent on the secure channel are authenticated—and sensitive information such as passwords are encrypted—but the integrity of the channel is not checked, and not all information is encrypted.

segment.source: If a system is set to always encrypt or sign secure channel data, a secure channel cannot be established with a domain controller that is not capable of signing or encrypting all secure channel traffic.
segment.target: If a system is set to always encrypt or sign secure channel data, a secure channel cannot be established with a domain controller that is not capable of signing or encrypting all secure channel traffic.

segment.source: If the computer is configured to encrypt or sign secure channel data when possible, a secure channel can be established, but the level of encryption and signing is negotiated.
segment.target: If the computer is configured to encrypt or sign secure channel data when possible, a secure channel can be established, but the level of encryption and signing is negotiated.

segment.source: Possible values
segment.target: Possible values

segment.source: Enabled
segment.target: Enabled

segment.source: The domain member will request encryption of all secure channel traffic.
segment.target: The domain member will request encryption of all secure channel traffic.

segment.source: If the domain controller supports encryption of all secure channel traffic, then all secure channel traffic will be encrypted.
segment.target: If the domain controller supports encryption of all secure channel traffic, then all secure channel traffic will be encrypted.

segment.source: Otherwise, only logon information that is transmitted over the secure channel will be encrypted.
segment.target: Otherwise, only logon information that is transmitted over the secure channel will be encrypted.

segment.source: Disabled
segment.target: Disabled

segment.source: The domain member will not attempt to negotiate secure channel encryption.
segment.target: The domain member will not attempt to negotiate secure channel encryption.

segment.source: Note: If the security policy setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) is enabled, this setting will be overwritten.
segment.target: Note: If the security policy setting Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) is enabled, this setting will be overwritten.

segment.source: Not defined
segment.target: Not defined

segment.source: Best practices
segment.target: Best practices

segment.source: Set Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) to Enabled.
segment.target: Set Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always) to Enabled.

segment.source: Set Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) to Enabled.
segment.target: Set Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible) to Enabled.

segment.source: Set Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible) to Enabled.
segment.target: Set Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible) to Enabled.

segment.target: Location

segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesSecurity Options

segment.source: Policy management
segment.target: Policy management

segment.source: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features and tools that are available to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: Restart requirement
segment.target: Restart requirement

segment.source: None.
segment.target: None.

segment.source: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.
segment.target: Changes to this policy become effective without a device restart when they are saved locally or distributed through Group Policy.

segment.source: Group Policy
segment.target: Group Policy

segment.source: Distribution of this policy through Group Policy does not override the Local Security Policy setting.
segment.target: Distribution of this policy through Group Policy does not override the Local Security Policy setting.

segment.source: Security considerations
segment.target: Security considerations

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Vulnerability
segment.target: Vulnerability

segment.source: When a device joins a domain, a machine account is created.
segment.target: When a device joins a domain, a machine account is created.

segment.source: After it joins the domain, the device uses the password for that account to create a secure channel with the domain controller for its domain every time it restarts.
segment.target: After it joins the domain, the device uses the password for that account to create a secure channel with the domain controller for its domain every time it restarts.

segment.source: Requests that are sent on the secure channel are authenticated—and sensitive information such as passwords are encrypted—but the channel is not integrity-checked, and not all information is encrypted.
segment.target: Requests that are sent on the secure channel are authenticated—and sensitive information such as passwords are encrypted—but the channel is not integrity-checked, and not all information is encrypted.

segment.source: If a device is configured to always encrypt or sign secure channel data but the domain controller cannot sign or encrypt any portion of the secure channel data, the computer and domain controller cannot establish a secure channel.
segment.target: If a device is configured to always encrypt or sign secure channel data but the domain controller cannot sign or encrypt any portion of the secure channel data, the computer and domain controller cannot establish a secure channel.

segment.source: If the computer is configured to encrypt or sign secure channel data when possible, a secure channel can be established, but the level of encryption and signing is negotiated.
segment.target: If the computer is configured to encrypt or sign secure channel data when possible, a secure channel can be established, but the level of encryption and signing is negotiated.

segment.source: Countermeasure
segment.target: Countermeasure

segment.source: Select one of the following settings as appropriate for your environment to configure the computers in your domain to encrypt or sign secure channel data:
segment.target: Select one of the following settings as appropriate for your environment to configure the computers in your domain to encrypt or sign secure channel data:

segment.source: Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)
segment.target: Domain member: Digitally encrypt or sign secure channel data (always)

segment.source: Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)
segment.target: Domain member: Digitally encrypt secure channel data (when possible)

segment.source: Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)
segment.target: Domain member: Digitally sign secure channel data (when possible)

segment.source: Potential impact
segment.target: Potential impact

segment.source: Digital signing of the secure channel is a good idea because it protects domain credentials as they are sent to the domain controller.
segment.target: Digital signing of the secure channel is a good idea because it protects domain credentials as they are sent to the domain controller.
